wiki.content:
"Master Blaster (Jammin')" peaked at #1 on the U.S. Billboard Hot Soul Singles Chart in the Autumn of 1980.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Master Blaster (Jammin')" peaked at #1 on the U.S. Billboard Hot Soul Singles Chart in the Autumn of 1980.

track.name: Master Blaster (Jammin')
comments: seriously? Ashanti is a similar artist? Fuck outta here
They don't make music like this anymore............so sad!
where we go....jammin n jammin n jammin n jammin    in the middle of the master blaster jammin.
"Master Blaster (Jammin') was Stevie Wonder's single #1 Hit in 1980. It remained in the #1 R&B Spot for Seven Weeks!
I love this, Stevie doing reggae, brilliant.  The best Bob Marley tribute song there is.
Wish he'd done more songs overlty referencing that Marley-reggae vibe. Masterblaster's such a corker. Just brims over with enthusiasm and da funk. [2]
this release is so more universal than bob marley's one
great track from stevie brings back lots of good memories !!!
F-ck ya! Time to blare my radio up. And I'm not sorry neighbors:)
